lustre/tests/flock_deadlock.c

00029 #include <stdarg.h>
00030 #include <stdio.h>
00031 #include <stdlib.h>
00032 #include <sys/file.h>
00033 #include <unistd.h>
00034 #include <fcntl.h>
00035 #include <stdarg.h>
00036 #include <string.h>
00037 #include <errno.h>
00038 #include <sys/types.h>
00039 #include <sys/wait.h>
00040 #include <sys/sem.h>
00041 #include <semaphore.h>
00042 #include <sys/mman.h>
00043 #include <sys/stat.h>
00044 #include <errno.h>
00045 
00046 #define LOCK_LEN 100
00047 
00048 struct flock flocks[4] = {
00049         /* 1st region */
00050         {
00051                 .l_type         = F_WRLCK,
00052                 .l_whence       = SEEK_SET,
00053                 .l_start        = 0,
00054                 .l_len          = LOCK_LEN,
00055                 .l_pid          = 0,
00056         },
00057         /* 2nd region */
00058         {
00059                 .l_type         = F_WRLCK,
00060                 .l_whence       = SEEK_SET,
00061                 .l_start        = LOCK_LEN,
00062                 .l_len          = LOCK_LEN,
00063                 .l_pid          = 0,
00064         },
00065         /* 3rd region */
00066         {
00067                 .l_type         = F_WRLCK,
00068                 .l_whence       = SEEK_SET,
00069                 .l_start        = 2 * LOCK_LEN,
00070                 .l_len          = LOCK_LEN,
00071                 .l_pid          = 0,
00072         },
00073         /* 2nd & 3rd regions */
00074         {
00075                 .l_type         = F_WRLCK,
00076                 .l_whence       = SEEK_SET,
00077                 .l_start        = LOCK_LEN,
00078                 .l_len          = 2 * LOCK_LEN,
00079                 .l_pid          = 0,
00080         },
00081 };
00082 
00083 enum {
00084         FLOCK_GET       = 0,
00085         FLOCK_PUT       = 1,
00086 };
00087 
00088 #define flock_call(fd, num, get, label)                                         \
00089         flocks[num].l_type = get == FLOCK_GET ? F_WRLCK : F_UNLCK;              \
00090         printf("%d: %s lock%d [%llu, %llu]\n", pid,                             \
00091                 get == FLOCK_GET ? "taking" : "putting",                        \
00092                 num, (unsigned long long)flocks[num].l_start,                   \
00093                 (unsigned long long)flocks[num].l_start + flocks[num].l_len);   \
00094         rc = fcntl(fd, F_SETLKW, &flocks[num]);                                 \
00095         if (rc < 0) {                                                           \
00096                 rc = errno;                                                     \
00097                 fprintf(stderr, "%d: failed to %s lock%d, %s\n",                \
00098                         pid, get == FLOCK_GET ? "take" : "put",                 \
00099                         num, strerror(errno));                                  \
00100                 goto label;                                                     \
00101         } else {                                                                \
00102                 printf("%d: done\n", pid);                                      \
00103         }
00104 
00105 void catch_alarm()
00106 {
00107         fprintf(stderr, "lock timeout\n");
00108         exit(124);
00109 }
00110 
00111 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00112 {
00113         struct sigaction act;
00114         int status;
00115         pid_t wpid = 0;
00116         int fd, i, pid, num = 0, rc = 0;
00117 
00118         if (argc != 2) {
00119                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <file>\n", argv[0]);
00120                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
00121         }
00122         fd = open(argv[1], O_RDWR|O_CREAT, (mode_t)0666);
00123         if (fd < 0) {
00124                 fprintf(stderr, "error open file %s\n", argv[1]);
00125                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
00126         }
00127 
00128         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00129                 fflush(stdout);
00130                 pid = fork();
00131                 if (pid && i == 0)
00132                         wpid = pid;
00133                 if (pid == 0)
00134                         wpid = 0;
00135                 if (pid == 0 && i == 0) {
00136                         pid = getpid();
00137 
00138                         flock_call(fd, num, FLOCK_GET, err_lock0);
00139 
00140                         printf("%d sleeping 1\n", pid);
00141                         sleep(1);
00142 
00143                         /* First of all, it should get blocked on flocks[1]
00144                          * 2nd child. Later, should deadlock with flocks[2]
00145                          * parent, after cancelling flocks[1] 2nd child. */
00146                         printf("%d: taking lock3 [%llu, %llu]\n", pid,
00147                                 (unsigned long long)flocks[3].l_start,
00148                                 (unsigned long long)flocks[3].l_start +
00149                                 flocks[3].l_len);
00150                         memset(&act, 0, sizeof(act));
00151                         act.sa_handler = catch_alarm;
00152                         sigemptyset(&act.sa_mask);
00153                         sigaddset(&act.sa_mask, SIGALRM);
00154                         if (sigaction(SIGALRM, &act, NULL) < 0) {
00155                                 fprintf(stderr, "SIGALRM signal setup failed"
00156                                                 ", errno: %d", errno);
00157                                 rc = 3;
00158                                 goto err_lock1;
00159                         }
00160                         alarm(5);
00161                         rc = fcntl(fd, F_SETLKW, &flocks[3]);
00162                         if (rc >= 0) {
00163                                 fprintf(stderr, "%d: should not succeed to "
00164                                                 "take lock3\n", pid);
00165 
00166                                 flock_call(fd, 3, FLOCK_PUT, err_lock1);
00167                                 rc = EINVAL;
00168                                 goto err_lock1;
00169                         }
00170                         if (errno != EDEADLK) {
00171                                 rc = errno;
00172                                 fprintf(stderr, "%d: failed to take lock3: "
00173                                                 "%s\n", pid, strerror(errno));
00174                                 goto err_lock1;
00175                         }
00176 
00177                         printf("%d: expected deadlock\n", pid);
00178 
00179                         flock_call(fd, num, FLOCK_PUT, err_lock0);
00180                         break;
00181                 } else if (pid == 0 && i == 1) {
00182                         pid = getpid();
00183 
00184                         flock_call(fd, 1, FLOCK_GET, err_lock0);
00185 
00186                         /* Let flocks[2] 2nd child get granted and
00187                          * flocks[3] 1st child, flocks[0] parent get blocked.*/
00188                         printf("%d sleeping 2\n", pid);
00189                         sleep(2);
00190 
00191                         flock_call(fd, 1, FLOCK_PUT, err_lock0);
00192                         break;
00193                 } else if (pid && i == 1) {
00194                         pid = getpid();
00195                         num = 2;
00196 
00197                         /* Let flocks[1] 2nd child get granted first */
00198                         printf("%d: sleeping 1\n", pid);
00199                         sleep(1);
00200 
00201                         flock_call(fd, num, FLOCK_GET, err_lock0);
00202 
00203                         /* Should get blocked on flocks[0], 1st shild
00204                          * and succeed later. */
00205                         flock_call(fd, 0, FLOCK_GET, err_lock1);
00206 
00207                         flock_call(fd, 0, FLOCK_PUT, err_lock1);
00208                         flock_call(fd, num, FLOCK_PUT, err_lock0);
00209                         break;
00210                 }
00211         }
00212 
00213         if (pid == 0)
00214                 sleep(2);
00215         if (wpid) {
00216                 waitpid(wpid, &status, 0);
00217                 rc = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00218         }
00219         printf("%d Exit\n", pid);
00220         close(fd);
00221         return rc;
00222 
00223 err_lock1:
00224         flocks[num].l_type = F_UNLCK;
00225         fcntl(fd, F_SETLKW, &flocks[num]);
00226 err_lock0:
00227         close(fd);
00228         return rc;
00229 }
